definition: evil influence/unhealthy trend/(a person's) evil air/aura of wickedness/(TCM) pathogenic energy (opposite: 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4], vital energy)
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
noxious winds, evil influences (idiom); malignant social trends

sentences.english: People thought the banging and popping could help drive away evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 人们认为鞭炮齐鸣能驱赶邪气。

sentences.english: The iniquities of the unions are her pet peeve at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 此时协会中的歪风邪气是令她最气恼的事。

sentences.english: They are said to be able to ward off evil.
sentences.chinese: 据说戴香布囊可以驱除邪气呢。

sentences.english: This shows that as soon as we slacken our efforts, evil trends will crop up.
sentences.chinese: 这说明，一旦搞得不好，歪风邪气就会。

sentences.english: At that moment the risk of contagion would be at its greatest.
sentences.chinese: 到那个时候，这种歪风邪气的风险将会上升到最大值。

sentences.english: We must eradicate the unhealthy tendency of cheating in exams.
sentences.chinese: 我们一定要杜绝考试作弊的歪风邪气。

sentences.english: "The healthy tendency is insufficient" and external "the perverse trend detention" with in vivo concerns.
sentences.chinese: 与体内“正气不足”和外来的“邪气滞留”有关。

sentences.english: This article is aiming at clarifying the confusion and vagueness of concept of etiology and pathogen in traditional Chinese medicine.
sentences.chinese: 对中医学中病因与邪气概念的混乱模糊现象进行澄清。

sentences.english: Underlying millennium pullbacks haughty ghosts haughty.
sentences.chinese: 潜藏千年邪气高傲高傲的鬼魅。

definition: demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal
to vent one's anger on (an innocent party)/to take it out on (sb)
baleful look/inauspicious influence/(of a tire, balloon etc) to leak air
healthy environment/healthy atmosphere/righteousness/vital energy (in Chinese medicine)
pathogeny (cause of disease) in TCM/as opposed to vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4]
clotted blood/extravasated blood (leaking into surrounding tissue)/thrombosis
